channel.title: Making a server ip work (need help paying)
channel.description:
ok my ipduc wont work when i run ipduc it says its working but when i try put on moparscape page it says it must be online for me to add and wont let any 1 log in
some 1 help payment is - 1m real rs cash or admin - co owner in the server im making - coded and silab with specs and veng
im not stupid -.- just wont work, it ustu work but not any more please help

yes, i will

Regular portfowarding is easy, personally i think if you cannot do that, you pretty should end your life right there. Whats so hard about typing your Default gateway, click a button here and there, and typing in your router ip? Your “thing” doesn’t even make sense, well to me.

But if i helped you, hope you feel bad

item.source: Making a server ip work (need help paying)

item.title: Making a server ip work (need help paying)
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“Darque Star, post:2, topic:158298”]MY Idea, i have not found this ANYWHERE else. I found this out screwing around with my computer! think of it what you want. but if this helped you, YOUR WELCOME REMEMBER - i was on the same boat as many of you, can’t put up my server because the ports weren’t forwarded, i then found this out, and now it works!

STEP 1
Click The Start Button
In The Start Menu, Click Connect to…SHOW ALL CONNECTIONS
Right-Click The “Internet Connection” With The Globe In The Background && PC In Front!
Click Properties…
Click “settings”

STEP 2
PORTFORWARDING PRIVATE SERVER
click “add…”
Description of service: MOPAR
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 43594
Internal Port: 43594
TCP: YES
UDP: NO

STEP 3
PORTFORWARDING NO-IP
click “add…”
Description of service: NO-IP
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 8245
Internal Port: 8245
TCP: YES
UDP: NO
DO BOTH PORTFORWARDING NO-IP AND MOPAR IF YOU ARE HAVING MAJOR PROBLEMS!
STEP 4
RECOMPILE AND START SERVER!

[u]Remember to enjoy!

100% Creds To Darque Star (NOT LEECHED)

QUESTIONS OR COMMENTS - REPLY OR EMAIL ME - joshownsyou@hotmail.com[/quote]

Umm equivalent to dirt? Step 2 does not follow up from step 1. I don’t even understand you. Wtf is with port 8245?

Read full topic
item.source: Making a server ip work (need help paying)

item.title: Making a server ip work (need help paying)
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

MY Idea, i have not found this ANYWHERE else. I found this out screwing around with my computer! think of it what you want. but if this helped you, YOUR WELCOME REMEMBER - i was on the same boat as many of you, can’t put up my server because the ports weren’t forwarded, i then found this out, and now it works!

STEP 1
Click The Start Button
In The Start Menu, Click Connect to…SHOW ALL CONNECTIONS
Right-Click The “Internet Connection” With The Globe In The Background && PC In Front!
Click Properties…
Click “settings”

STEP 2
PORTFORWARDING PRIVATE SERVER
click “add…”
Description of service: MOPAR
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 43594
Internal Port: 43594
TCP: YES
UDP: NO
CLICK OK…

STEP 3
PORTFORWARDING NO-IP
click “add…”
Description of service: NO-IP
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 8245
Internal Port: 8245
TCP: YES
UDP: NO
DO BOTH PORTFORWARDING NO-IP AND MOPAR IF YOU ARE HAVING MAJOR PROBLEMS!
CLICK OK…

STEP 4
CLICK OK…
RECOMPILE AND START SERVER!

[u]Remember to enjoy!

100% Creds To Darque Star (NOT LEECHED)

QUESTIONS OR COMMENTS - REPLY OR EMAIL ME - joshownsyou@hotmail.com

Read full topic
